--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateBackendAuthIdentityPoolConfig</a> smart

--   authorization to your Amplify app.
[$sel:unauthenticatedLogin:CreateBackendAuthIdentityPoolConfig'] :: CreateBackendAuthIdentityPoolConfig -> Bool

--   <a>createBackendAuthIdentityPoolConfig_identityPoolName</a> - Name of

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig</a> smart

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig</a> with

--   Additional constraints for the password used to access the backend of
--   your Amplify project.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minimumLength:CreateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig'</a>,
--   <a>createBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig_minimumLength</a> - The
--   minimum length of the password used to access the backend of your
--   Amplify project.
newCreateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig :: Double -> CreateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig

-- | Additional constraints for the password used to access the backend of
--   your Amplify project.
createBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig_additionalConstraints :: Lens' CreateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig (Maybe [AdditionalConstraintsElement])

-- | The minimum length of the password used to access the backend of your
--   Amplify project.
createBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig_minimumLength :: Lens' CreateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig Double
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.CreateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig.CreateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.CreateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig.CreateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.CreateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig.CreateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.CreateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig.CreateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.CreateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig.CreateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.CreateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig.CreateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.CreateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig.CreateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.CreateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig.CreateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig

module Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.EmailSettings

-- | The configuration for the email sent when an app user forgets their
--   password.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEmailSettings</a> smart constructor.
data EmailSettings
EmailSettings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> EmailSettings

-- | The subject of the email.
[$sel:emailSubject:EmailSettings'] :: EmailSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The body of the email.
[$sel:emailMessage:EmailSettings'] :: EmailSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EmailSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailSubject:EmailSettings'</a>,
--   <a>emailSettings_emailSubject</a> - The subject of the email.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailMessage:EmailSettings'</a>,
--   <a>emailSettings_emailMessage</a> - The body of the email.
newEmailSettings :: EmailSettings

-- | The subject of the email.
emailSettings_emailSubject :: Lens' EmailSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The body of the email.
emailSettings_emailMessage :: Lens' EmailSettings (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.EmailSettings.EmailSettings

module Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.LoginAuthConfigReqObj

-- | The request object for this operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLoginAuthConfigReqObj</a> smart constructor.
data LoginAuthConfigReqObj
LoginAuthConfigReqObj' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> LoginAuthConfigReqObj

-- | The web client ID for the Amazon Cognito user pools.
[$sel:awsUserPoolsWebClientId:LoginAuthConfigReqObj'] :: LoginAuthConfigReqObj -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Cognito identity pool ID used for the Amplify Admin UI
--   login authorization.
[$sel:awsCognitoIdentityPoolId:LoginAuthConfigReqObj'] :: LoginAuthConfigReqObj -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Cognito user pool ID used for Amplify Admin UI login
--   authentication.
[$sel:awsUserPoolsId:LoginAuthConfigReqObj'] :: LoginAuthConfigReqObj -> Maybe Text

-- | The AWS Region for the Amplify Admin UI login.
[$sel:awsCognitoRegion:LoginAuthConfigReqObj'] :: LoginAuthConfigReqObj -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>LoginAuthConfigReqObj</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsUserPoolsWebClientId:LoginAuthConfigReqObj'</a>,
--   <a>loginAuthConfigReqObj_awsUserPoolsWebClientId</a> - The web client
--   ID for the Amazon Cognito user pools.
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsCognitoIdentityPoolId:LoginAuthConfigReqObj'</a>,
--   <a>loginAuthConfigReqObj_awsCognitoIdentityPoolId</a> - The Amazon
--   Cognito identity pool ID used for the Amplify Admin UI login
--   authorization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsUserPoolsId:LoginAuthConfigReqObj'</a>,
--   <a>loginAuthConfigReqObj_awsUserPoolsId</a> - The Amazon Cognito user
--   pool ID used for Amplify Admin UI login authentication.
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsCognitoRegion:LoginAuthConfigReqObj'</a>,
--   <a>loginAuthConfigReqObj_awsCognitoRegion</a> - The AWS Region for the
--   Amplify Admin UI login.
newLoginAuthConfigReqObj :: LoginAuthConfigReqObj

-- | The web client ID for the Amazon Cognito user pools.
loginAuthConfigReqObj_awsUserPoolsWebClientId :: Lens' LoginAuthConfigReqObj (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Cognito identity pool ID used for the Amplify Admin UI
--   login authorization.
loginAuthConfigReqObj_awsCognitoIdentityPoolId :: Lens' LoginAuthConfigReqObj (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Cognito user pool ID used for Amplify Admin UI login
--   authentication.
loginAuthConfigReqObj_awsUserPoolsId :: Lens' LoginAuthConfigReqObj (Maybe Text)

-- | The AWS Region for the Amplify Admin UI login.
loginAuthConfigReqObj_awsCognitoRegion :: Lens' LoginAuthConfigReqObj (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.LoginAuthConfigReqObj.LoginAuthConfigReqObj
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.LoginAuthConfigReqObj.LoginAuthConfigReqObj

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackendAPIAuthType</a> smart constructor.
data BackendAPIAuthType

[$sel:settings:BackendAPIAuthType'] :: BackendAPIAuthType -> Maybe BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings

--   authentication mode.
--

--   Describes the authentication mode.
newBackendAPIAuthType :: BackendAPIAuthType

backendAPIAuthType_settings :: Lens' BackendAPIAuthType (Maybe BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings)

module Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.BackendAPIConflictResolution

-- | Describes the conflict resolution configuration for your data model
--   configured in your Amplify project.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackendAPIConflictResolution</a> smart constructor.
data BackendAPIConflictResolution
BackendAPIConflictResolution' :: Maybe ResolutionStrategy -> BackendAPIConflictResolution

-- | The strategy for conflict resolution.
[$sel:resolutionStrategy:BackendAPIConflictResolution'] :: BackendAPIConflictResolution -> Maybe ResolutionStrategy

-- | Create a value of <a>BackendAPIConflictResolution</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resolutionStrategy:BackendAPIConflictResolution'</a>,
--   <a>backendAPIConflictResolution_resolutionStrategy</a> - The strategy
--   for conflict resolution.
newBackendAPIConflictResolution :: BackendAPIConflictResolution

-- | The strategy for conflict resolution.
backendAPIConflictResolution_resolutionStrategy :: Lens' BackendAPIConflictResolution (Maybe ResolutionStrategy)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.BackendAPIConflictResolution.BackendAPIConflictResolution
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.BackendAPIConflictResolution.BackendAPIConflictResolution
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.BackendAPIConflictResolution.BackendAPIConflictResolution

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.BackendAPIConflictResolution.BackendAPIConflictResolution

module Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.BackendAPIResourceConfig

-- | The resource config for the data model, configured as a part of the
--   Amplify project.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackendAPIResourceConfig</a> smart constructor.
data BackendAPIResourceConfig
BackendAPIResourceConfig' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [BackendAPIAuthType] -> Maybe BackendAPIConflictResolution -> Maybe BackendAPIAuthType -> BackendAPIResourceConfig

-- | The API name used to interact with the data model, configured as a
--   part of your Amplify project.
[$sel:apiName:BackendAPIResourceConfig'] :: BackendAPIResourceConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The service used to provision and interact with the data model.
[$sel:service:BackendAPIResourceConfig'] :: BackendAPIResourceConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The definition of the data model in the annotated transform of the
--   GraphQL schema.
[$sel:transformSchema:BackendAPIResourceConfig'] :: BackendAPIResourceConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | Additional authentication methods used to interact with your data
--   models.
[$sel:additionalAuthTypes:BackendAPIResourceConfig'] :: BackendAPIResourceConfig -> Maybe [BackendAPIAuthType]

-- | The conflict resolution strategy for your data stored in the data
--   models.
[$sel:conflictResolution:BackendAPIResourceConfig'] :: BackendAPIResourceConfig -> Maybe BackendAPIConflictResolution

-- | The default authentication type for interacting with the configured
--   data models in your Amplify project.
[$sel:defaultAuthType:BackendAPIResourceConfig'] :: BackendAPIResourceConfig -> Maybe BackendAPIAuthType

-- | Create a value of <a>BackendAPIResourceConfig</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:apiName:BackendAPIResourceConfig'</a>,
--   <a>backendAPIResourceConfig_apiName</a> - The API name used to
--   interact with the data model, configured as a part of your Amplify
--   project.
--   
--   <a>$sel:service:BackendAPIResourceConfig'</a>,
--   <a>backendAPIResourceConfig_service</a> - The service used to
--   provision and interact with the data model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transformSchema:BackendAPIResourceConfig'</a>,
--   <a>backendAPIResourceConfig_transformSchema</a> - The definition of
--   the data model in the annotated transform of the GraphQL schema.
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalAuthTypes:BackendAPIResourceConfig'</a>,
--   <a>backendAPIResourceConfig_additionalAuthTypes</a> - Additional
--   authentication methods used to interact with your data models.
--   
--   <a>$sel:conflictResolution:BackendAPIResourceConfig'</a>,
--   <a>backendAPIResourceConfig_conflictResolution</a> - The conflict
--   resolution strategy for your data stored in the data models.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultAuthType:BackendAPIResourceConfig'</a>,
--   <a>backendAPIResourceConfig_defaultAuthType</a> - The default
--   authentication type for interacting with the configured data models in
--   your Amplify project.
newBackendAPIResourceConfig :: BackendAPIResourceConfig

-- | The API name used to interact with the data model, configured as a
--   part of your Amplify project.
backendAPIResourceConfig_apiName :: Lens' BackendAPIResourceConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | The service used to provision and interact with the data model.
backendAPIResourceConfig_service :: Lens' BackendAPIResourceConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | The definition of the data model in the annotated transform of the
--   GraphQL schema.
backendAPIResourceConfig_transformSchema :: Lens' BackendAPIResourceConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | Additional authentication methods used to interact with your data
--   models.
backendAPIResourceConfig_additionalAuthTypes :: Lens' BackendAPIResourceConfig (Maybe [BackendAPIAuthType])

-- | The conflict resolution strategy for your data stored in the data
--   models.
backendAPIResourceConfig_conflictResolution :: Lens' BackendAPIResourceConfig (Maybe BackendAPIConflictResolution)

-- | The default authentication type for interacting with the configured
--   data models in your Amplify project.
backendAPIResourceConfig_defaultAuthType :: Lens' BackendAPIResourceConfig (Maybe BackendAPIAuthType)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.BackendAPIResourceConfig.BackendAPIResourceConfig
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.BackendAPIResourceConfig.BackendAPIResourceConfig
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.BackendAPIResourceConfig.BackendAPIResourceConfig
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.BackendAPIResourceConfig.BackendAPIResourceConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.BackendAPIResourceConfig.BackendAPIResourceConfig
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.BackendAPIResourceConfig.BackendAPIResourceConfig
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.BackendAPIResourceConfig.BackendAPIResourceConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.BackendAPIResourceConfig.BackendAPIResourceConfig

module Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.Settings

-- | The settings of your MFA configuration for the backend of your Amplify
--   project.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSettings</a> smart constructor.
data Settings
Settings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [MfaTypesElement] -> Settings

-- | The body of the SMS message.
[$sel:smsMessage:Settings'] :: Settings -> Maybe Text

-- | The supported MFA types.
[$sel:mfaTypes:Settings'] :: Settings -> Maybe [MfaTypesElement]

-- | Create a value of <a>Settings</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:smsMessage:Settings'</a>, <a>settings_smsMessage</a> - The
--   body of the SMS message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mfaTypes:Settings'</a>, <a>settings_mfaTypes</a> - The
--   supported MFA types.
newSettings :: Settings

-- | The body of the SMS message.
settings_smsMessage :: Lens' Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | The supported MFA types.
settings_mfaTypes :: Lens' Settings (Maybe [MfaTypesElement])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.Settings.Settings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.Settings.Settings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.Settings.Settings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.Settings.Settings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.Settings.Settings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.Settings.Settings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.Settings.Settings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.Settings.Settings


module Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.CreateBackendAuthMFAConfig

-- | Describes whether to apply multi-factor authentication policies for
--   your Amazon Cognito user pool configured as a part of your Amplify
--   project.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateBackendAuthMFAConfig</a> smart constructor.
data CreateBackendAuthMFAConfig
CreateBackendAuthMFAConfig' :: Maybe Settings -> MFAMode -> CreateBackendAuthMFAConfig

-- | Describes the configuration settings and methods for your Amplify app
--   users to use MFA.
[$sel:settings:CreateBackendAuthMFAConfig'] :: CreateBackendAuthMFAConfig -> Maybe Settings

-- | Describes whether MFA should be [ON, OFF, or OPTIONAL] for
--   authentication in your Amplify project.
[$sel:mfaMode:CreateBackendAuthMFAConfig'] :: CreateBackendAuthMFAConfig -> MFAMode

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateBackendAuthMFAConfig</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:settings:CreateBackendAuthMFAConfig'</a>,
--   <a>createBackendAuthMFAConfig_settings</a> - Describes the
--   configuration settings and methods for your Amplify app users to use
--   MFA.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mfaMode:CreateBackendAuthMFAConfig'</a>,
--   <a>createBackendAuthMFAConfig_mfaMode</a> - Describes whether MFA
--   should be [ON, OFF, or OPTIONAL] for authentication in your Amplify
--   project.
newCreateBackendAuthMFAConfig :: MFAMode -> CreateBackendAuthMFAConfig

-- | Describes the configuration settings and methods for your Amplify app
--   users to use MFA.
createBackendAuthMFAConfig_settings :: Lens' CreateBackendAuthMFAConfig (Maybe Settings)

-- | Describes whether MFA should be [ON, OFF, or OPTIONAL] for
--   authentication in your Amplify project.
createBackendAuthMFAConfig_mfaMode :: Lens' CreateBackendAuthMFAConfig MFAMode

--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   The body of the SMS message.

module Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig

-- | Describes the forgot password policy for authenticating into the
--   Amplify app.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig
CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig' :: Maybe EmailSettings -> Maybe SmsSettings -> DeliveryMethod -> CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig

-- | The configuration for the email sent when an app user forgets their
--   password.
[$sel:emailSettings:CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig'] :: CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig -> Maybe EmailSettings

-- | The configuration for the SMS message sent when an app user forgets
--   their password.
[$sel:smsSettings:CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig'] :: CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig -> Maybe SmsSettings

-- | Describes which mode to use (either SMS or email) to deliver messages
--   to app users who want to recover their password.
[$sel:deliveryMethod:CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig'] :: CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig -> DeliveryMethod

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailSettings:CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig'</a>,
--   <a>createBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig_emailSettings</a> - The
--   configuration for the email sent when an app user forgets their
--   password.
--   
--   <a>$sel:smsSettings:CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig'</a>,
--   <a>createBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig_smsSettings</a> - The
--   configuration for the SMS message sent when an app user forgets their
--   password.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryMethod:CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig'</a>,
--   <a>createBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig_deliveryMethod</a> -
--   Describes which mode to use (either SMS or email) to deliver messages
--   to app users who want to recover their password.
newCreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig :: DeliveryMethod -> CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig

-- | The configuration for the email sent when an app user forgets their
--   password.
createBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig_emailSettings :: Lens' CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig (Maybe EmailSettings)

-- | The configuration for the SMS message sent when an app user forgets
--   their password.
createBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig_smsSettings :: Lens' CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig (Maybe SmsSettings)

-- | Describes which mode to use (either SMS or email) to deliver messages
--   to app users who want to recover their password.
createBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig_deliveryMethod :: Lens' CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig DeliveryMethod
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig.CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig.CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig.CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig.CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig.CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig.CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig.CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig.CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig


module Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.SocialProviderSettings

-- | The settings for using the social identity providers for access to
--   your Amplify app.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSocialProviderSettings</a> smart constructor.
data SocialProviderSettings
SocialProviderSettings' :: Maybe BackendAuthSocialProviderConfig -> Maybe BackendAuthAppleProviderConfig -> Maybe BackendAuthSocialProviderConfig -> Maybe BackendAuthSocialProviderConfig -> SocialProviderSettings
[$sel:loginWithAmazon:SocialProviderSettings'] :: SocialProviderSettings -> Maybe BackendAuthSocialProviderConfig
[$sel:signInWithApple:SocialProviderSettings'] :: SocialProviderSettings -> Maybe BackendAuthAppleProviderConfig
[$sel:facebook:SocialProviderSettings'] :: SocialProviderSettings -> Maybe BackendAuthSocialProviderConfig
[$sel:google:SocialProviderSettings'] :: SocialProviderSettings -> Maybe BackendAuthSocialProviderConfig

module Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig

-- | Creates the OAuth configuration for your Amplify project.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig</a> smart constructor.
data CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig
CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig' :: Maybe SocialProviderSettings -> Maybe Text -> [Text] -> [Text] -> OAuthGrantType -> [OAuthScopesElement] -> CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig

-- | The settings for using social providers to access your Amplify app.
[$sel:socialProviderSettings:CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig'] :: CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig -> Maybe SocialProviderSettings

-- | The domain prefix for your Amplify app.
[$sel:domainPrefix:CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig'] :: CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | Redirect URLs that OAuth uses when a user signs out of an Amplify app.
[$sel:redirectSignOutURIs:CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig'] :: CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig -> [Text]

-- | The redirected URI for signing in to your Amplify app.
[$sel:redirectSignInURIs:CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig'] :: CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig -> [Text]

-- | The OAuth grant type that you use to allow app users to authenticate
--   from your Amplify app.
[$sel:oAuthGrantType:CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig'] :: CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig -> OAuthGrantType

-- | List of OAuth-related flows used to allow your app users to
--   authenticate from your Amplify app.
[$sel:oAuthScopes:CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig'] :: CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig -> [OAuthScopesElement]

--   optional fields omitted.

module Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.CreateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig

-- | Describes the Amazon Cognito user pool configuration for the auth
--   resource to be configured for your Amplify project.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CreateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig
CreateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig' :: Maybe CreateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig -> Maybe CreateBackendAuthMFAConfig -> Maybe CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig -> Maybe CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig -> [RequiredSignUpAttributesElement] -> SignInMethod -> Text -> CreateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig

--   configured as a part of your Amplify project.
[$sel:passwordPolicy:CreateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig'] :: CreateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig -> Maybe CreateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig

--   your Amazon Cognito user pool configured as a part of your Amplify
--   project.

--   pool, configured as a part of your Amplify project.

--   pool, configured as a part of your Amplify project.

--   in using the Amazon Cognito user pool, configured as a part of your
--   Amplify project.
[$sel:signInMethod:CreateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig'] :: CreateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig -> SignInMethod

[$sel:userPoolName:CreateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig'] :: CreateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig -> Text

--   optional fields omitted.

--

--   constructor.

--   identity pool, provisioned as a part of your auth resource in the
--   Amplify project.

--   authentication and authorization settings.

module Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.UpdateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig

-- | Describes the forgot password policy for authenticating into the
--   Amplify app.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig
UpdateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig' :: Maybe EmailSettings -> Maybe SmsSettings -> Maybe DeliveryMethod -> UpdateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig

-- | The configuration for the email sent when an app user forgets their
--   password.
[$sel:emailSettings:UpdateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig'] :: UpdateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig -> Maybe EmailSettings

-- | The configuration for the SMS message sent when an Amplify app user
--   forgets their password.
[$sel:smsSettings:UpdateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig'] :: UpdateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig -> Maybe SmsSettings

-- | Describes which mode to use (either SMS or email) to deliver messages
--   to app users that want to recover their password.
[$sel:deliveryMethod:UpdateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig'] :: UpdateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig -> Maybe DeliveryMethod

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailSettings:UpdateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig'</a>,
--   <a>updateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig_emailSettings</a> - The
--   configuration for the email sent when an app user forgets their
--   password.
--   
--   <a>$sel:smsSettings:UpdateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig'</a>,
--   <a>updateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig_smsSettings</a> - The
--   configuration for the SMS message sent when an Amplify app user
--   forgets their password.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryMethod:UpdateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig'</a>,
--   <a>updateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig_deliveryMethod</a> -
--   Describes which mode to use (either SMS or email) to deliver messages
--   to app users that want to recover their password.
newUpdateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig :: UpdateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig

-- | The configuration for the email sent when an app user forgets their
--   password.
updateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig_emailSettings :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig (Maybe EmailSettings)

-- | The configuration for the SMS message sent when an Amplify app user
--   forgets their password.
updateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig_smsSettings :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig (Maybe SmsSettings)

-- | Describes which mode to use (either SMS or email) to deliver messages
--   to app users that want to recover their password.
updateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig_deliveryMethod :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig (Maybe DeliveryMethod)

--   authorization into your Amplify app.

module Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.UpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig

-- | Updates the multi-factor authentication (MFA) configuration for the
--   backend of your Amplify project.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig
UpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig' :: Maybe Settings -> Maybe MFAMode -> UpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig

-- | The settings of your MFA configuration for the backend of your Amplify
--   project.
[$sel:settings:UpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig'] :: UpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig -> Maybe Settings

-- | The MFA mode for the backend of your Amplify project.
[$sel:mfaMode:UpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig'] :: UpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig -> Maybe MFAMode

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:settings:UpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig'</a>,
--   <a>updateBackendAuthMFAConfig_settings</a> - The settings of your MFA
--   configuration for the backend of your Amplify project.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mfaMode:UpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig'</a>,
--   <a>updateBackendAuthMFAConfig_mfaMode</a> - The MFA mode for the
--   backend of your Amplify project.
newUpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig :: UpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig

-- | The settings of your MFA configuration for the backend of your Amplify
--   project.
updateBackendAuthMFAConfig_settings :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig (Maybe Settings)

-- | The MFA mode for the backend of your Amplify project.
updateBackendAuthMFAConfig_mfaMode :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig (Maybe MFAMode)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.UpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig.UpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.UpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig.UpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.UpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig.UpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.UpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig.UpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.UpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig.UpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.UpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig.UpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.UpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig.UpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig


module Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig

-- | The OAuth configurations for authenticating users into your Amplify
--   app.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig
UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig' :: Maybe SocialProviderSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [OAuthScopesElement] -> Maybe OAuthGrantType -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig

-- | Describes third-party social federation configurations for allowing
--   your users to sign in with OAuth.
[$sel:socialProviderSettings:UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig'] :: UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig -> Maybe SocialProviderSettings

-- | The Amazon Cognito domain prefix used to create a hosted UI for
--   authentication.
[$sel:domainPrefix:UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig'] :: UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of OAuth-related flows that can allow users to authenticate
--   from your Amplify app.
[$sel:oAuthScopes:UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig'] :: UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig -> Maybe [OAuthScopesElement]

-- | The OAuth grant type to allow app users to authenticate from your
--   Amplify app.
[$sel:oAuthGrantType:UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig'] :: UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig -> Maybe OAuthGrantType

-- | Redirect URLs that OAuth uses when a user signs out of an Amplify app.
[$sel:redirectSignOutURIs:UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig'] :: UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Redirect URLs that OAuth uses when a user signs in to an Amplify app.
[$sel:redirectSignInURIs:UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig'] :: UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:socialProviderSettings:UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig'</a>,
--   <a>updateBackendAuthOAuthConfig_socialProviderSettings</a> - Describes
--   third-party social federation configurations for allowing your users
--   to sign in with OAuth.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainPrefix:UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig'</a>,
--   <a>updateBackendAuthOAuthConfig_domainPrefix</a> - The Amazon Cognito
--   domain prefix used to create a hosted UI for authentication.
--   
--   <a>$sel:oAuthScopes:UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig'</a>,
--   <a>updateBackendAuthOAuthConfig_oAuthScopes</a> - The list of
--   OAuth-related flows that can allow users to authenticate from your
--   Amplify app.
--   
--   <a>$sel:oAuthGrantType:UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig'</a>,
--   <a>updateBackendAuthOAuthConfig_oAuthGrantType</a> - The OAuth grant
--   type to allow app users to authenticate from your Amplify app.
--   
--   <a>$sel:redirectSignOutURIs:UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig'</a>,
--   <a>updateBackendAuthOAuthConfig_redirectSignOutURIs</a> - Redirect
--   URLs that OAuth uses when a user signs out of an Amplify app.
--   
--   <a>$sel:redirectSignInURIs:UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig'</a>,
--   <a>updateBackendAuthOAuthConfig_redirectSignInURIs</a> - Redirect URLs
--   that OAuth uses when a user signs in to an Amplify app.
newUpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig :: UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig

-- | Describes third-party social federation configurations for allowing
--   your users to sign in with OAuth.
updateBackendAuthOAuthConfig_socialProviderSettings :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig (Maybe SocialProviderSettings)

-- | The Amazon Cognito domain prefix used to create a hosted UI for
--   authentication.
updateBackendAuthOAuthConfig_domainPrefix :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of OAuth-related flows that can allow users to authenticate
--   from your Amplify app.
updateBackendAuthOAuthConfig_oAuthScopes :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig (Maybe [OAuthScopesElement])

-- | The OAuth grant type to allow app users to authenticate from your
--   Amplify app.
updateBackendAuthOAuthConfig_oAuthGrantType :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig (Maybe OAuthGrantType)

-- | Redirect URLs that OAuth uses when a user signs out of an Amplify app.
updateBackendAuthOAuthConfig_redirectSignOutURIs :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig (Maybe [Text])

-- | Redirect URLs that OAuth uses when a user signs in to an Amplify app.
updateBackendAuthOAuthConfig_redirectSignInURIs :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig (Maybe [Text])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig.UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig.UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig.UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig.UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig

instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig.UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig


module Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.UpdateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig

-- | Describes the password policy for your Amazon Cognito user pool
--   configured as a part of your Amplify project.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig
UpdateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig' :: Maybe [AdditionalConstraintsElement] -> Maybe Double -> UpdateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig

-- | Describes additional constraints on password requirements to sign in
--   to the auth resource, configured as a part of your Amplify project.
[$sel:additionalConstraints:UpdateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig'] :: UpdateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig -> Maybe [AdditionalConstraintsElement]

-- | Describes the minimum length of the password required to sign in to
--   the auth resource, configured as a part of your Amplify project.
[$sel:minimumLength:UpdateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig'] :: UpdateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig -> Maybe Double

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalConstraints:UpdateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig'</a>,
--   <a>updateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig_additionalConstraints</a> -
--   Describes additional constraints on password requirements to sign in
--   to the auth resource, configured as a part of your Amplify project.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minimumLength:UpdateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig'</a>,
--   <a>updateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig_minimumLength</a> - Describes
--   the minimum length of the password required to sign in to the auth
--   resource, configured as a part of your Amplify project.
newUpdateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig :: UpdateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig

-- | Describes additional constraints on password requirements to sign in
--   to the auth resource, configured as a part of your Amplify project.
updateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig_additionalConstraints :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig (Maybe [AdditionalConstraintsElement])

-- | Describes the minimum length of the password required to sign in to
--   the auth resource, configured as a part of your Amplify project.
updateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig_minimumLength :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig (Maybe Double)

module Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.UpdateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig

-- | Describes the Amazon Cognito user pool configuration for the
--   authorization resource to be configured for your Amplify project on an
--   update.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig
UpdateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig' :: Maybe UpdateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig -> Maybe UpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig -> Maybe UpdateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig -> Maybe UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig -> UpdateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig

-- | Describes the password policy for your Amazon Cognito user pool,
--   configured as a part of your Amplify project.
[$sel:passwordPolicy:UpdateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig'] :: UpdateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig -> Maybe UpdateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig

-- | Describes whether to apply multi-factor authentication policies for
--   your Amazon Cognito user pool configured as a part of your Amplify
--   project.
[$sel:mfa:UpdateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig'] :: UpdateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig -> Maybe UpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig

-- | Describes the forgot password policy for your Amazon Cognito user
--   pool, configured as a part of your Amplify project.
[$sel:forgotPassword:UpdateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig'] :: UpdateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig -> Maybe UpdateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig

-- | Describes the OAuth policy and rules for your Amazon Cognito user
--   pool, configured as a part of your Amplify project.
[$sel:oAuth:UpdateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig'] :: UpdateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig -> Maybe UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:passwordPolicy:UpdateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig'</a>,
--   <a>updateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig_passwordPolicy</a> - Describes the
--   password policy for your Amazon Cognito user pool, configured as a
--   part of your Amplify project.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mfa:UpdateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig'</a>,
--   <a>updateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig_mfa</a> - Describes whether to
--   apply multi-factor authentication policies for your Amazon Cognito
--   user pool configured as a part of your Amplify project.
--   
--   <a>$sel:forgotPassword:UpdateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig'</a>,
--   <a>updateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig_forgotPassword</a> - Describes the
--   forgot password policy for your Amazon Cognito user pool, configured
--   as a part of your Amplify project.
--   
--   <a>$sel:oAuth:UpdateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig'</a>,
--   <a>updateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig_oAuth</a> - Describes the OAuth
--   policy and rules for your Amazon Cognito user pool, configured as a
--   part of your Amplify project.
newUpdateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig :: UpdateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig

-- | Describes the password policy for your Amazon Cognito user pool,
--   configured as a part of your Amplify project.
updateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig_passwordPolicy :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig (Maybe UpdateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig)

-- | Describes whether to apply multi-factor authentication policies for
--   your Amazon Cognito user pool configured as a part of your Amplify
--   project.
updateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig_mfa :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig (Maybe UpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig)

-- | Describes the forgot password policy for your Amazon Cognito user
--   pool, configured as a part of your Amplify project.
updateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig_forgotPassword :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig (Maybe UpdateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig)

-- | Describes the OAuth policy and rules for your Amazon Cognito user
--   pool, configured as a part of your Amplify project.
updateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig_oAuth :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig (Maybe UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig)

module Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.UpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig

-- | Defines the resource configuration when updating an authentication
--   resource in your Amplify project.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig
UpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig' :: Maybe UpdateBackendAuthIdentityPoolConfig -> AuthResources -> UpdateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig -> Service -> UpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig

-- | Describes the authorization configuration for the Amazon Cognito
--   identity pool, provisioned as a part of your auth resource in the
--   Amplify project.
[$sel:identityPoolConfigs:UpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig'] :: UpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig -> Maybe UpdateBackendAuthIdentityPoolConfig

-- | Defines the service name to use when configuring an authentication
--   resource in your Amplify project.
[$sel:authResources:UpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig'] :: UpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig -> AuthResources

-- | Describes the authentication configuration for the Amazon Cognito user
--   pool, provisioned as a part of your auth resource in the Amplify
--   project.
[$sel:userPoolConfigs:UpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig'] :: UpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig -> UpdateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig

-- | Defines the service name to use when configuring an authentication
--   resource in your Amplify project.
[$sel:service:UpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig'] :: UpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig -> Service

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityPoolConfigs:UpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig'</a>,
--   <a>updateBackendAuthResourceConfig_identityPoolConfigs</a> - Describes
--   the authorization configuration for the Amazon Cognito identity pool,
--   provisioned as a part of your auth resource in the Amplify project.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authResources:UpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig'</a>,
--   <a>updateBackendAuthResourceConfig_authResources</a> - Defines the
--   service name to use when configuring an authentication resource in
--   your Amplify project.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userPoolConfigs:UpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig'</a>,
--   <a>updateBackendAuthResourceConfig_userPoolConfigs</a> - Describes the
--   authentication configuration for the Amazon Cognito user pool,
--   provisioned as a part of your auth resource in the Amplify project.
--   
--   <a>$sel:service:UpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig'</a>,
--   <a>updateBackendAuthResourceConfig_service</a> - Defines the service
--   name to use when configuring an authentication resource in your
--   Amplify project.
newUpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig :: AuthResources -> UpdateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig -> Service -> UpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig

-- | Describes the authorization configuration for the Amazon Cognito
--   identity pool, provisioned as a part of your auth resource in the
--   Amplify project.
updateBackendAuthResourceConfig_identityPoolConfigs :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig (Maybe UpdateBackendAuthIdentityPoolConfig)

-- | Defines the service name to use when configuring an authentication
--   resource in your Amplify project.
updateBackendAuthResourceConfig_authResources :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig AuthResources

-- | Describes the authentication configuration for the Amazon Cognito user
--   pool, provisioned as a part of your auth resource in the Amplify
--   project.
updateBackendAuthResourceConfig_userPoolConfigs :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig UpdateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig

-- | Defines the service name to use when configuring an authentication
--   resource in your Amplify project.
updateBackendAuthResourceConfig_service :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig Service
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.UpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig.UpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.UpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig.UpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types.UpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig.UpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig

module Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.Types

-- | API version <tt>2020-08-11</tt> of the Amazon AmplifyBackend SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | An error returned if there's a temporary issue with the service.
_GatewayTimeoutException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An error returned when a specific resource type is not found.
_NotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An error that is returned when a limit of a specific type has been
--   exceeded.
_TooManyRequestsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An error returned if a request is not formed properly.
_BadRequestException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError
newtype AdditionalConstraintsElement
AdditionalConstraintsElement' :: Text -> AdditionalConstraintsElement
[fromAdditionalConstraintsElement] :: AdditionalConstraintsElement -> Text
pattern AdditionalConstraintsElement_REQUIRE_DIGIT :: AdditionalConstraintsElement
pattern AdditionalConstraintsElement_REQUIRE_LOWERCASE :: AdditionalConstraintsElement
pattern AdditionalConstraintsElement_REQUIRE_SYMBOL :: AdditionalConstraintsElement
pattern AdditionalConstraintsElement_REQUIRE_UPPERCASE :: AdditionalConstraintsElement
newtype AuthResources
AuthResources' :: Text -> AuthResources
[fromAuthResources] :: AuthResources -> Text
pattern AuthResources_IDENTITY_POOL_AND_USER_POOL :: AuthResources
pattern AuthResources_USER_POOL_ONLY :: AuthResources
newtype DeliveryMethod
DeliveryMethod' :: Text -> DeliveryMethod
[fromDeliveryMethod] :: DeliveryMethod -> Text
pattern DeliveryMethod_EMAIL :: DeliveryMethod
pattern DeliveryMethod_SMS :: DeliveryMethod
newtype MFAMode
MFAMode' :: Text -> MFAMode
[fromMFAMode] :: MFAMode -> Text
pattern MFAMode_OFF :: MFAMode
pattern MFAMode_ON :: MFAMode
pattern MFAMode_OPTIONAL :: MFAMode
newtype MfaTypesElement
MfaTypesElement' :: Text -> MfaTypesElement
[fromMfaTypesElement] :: MfaTypesElement -> Text
pattern MfaTypesElement_SMS :: MfaTypesElement
pattern MfaTypesElement_TOTP :: MfaTypesElement
newtype Mode
Mode' :: Text -> Mode
[fromMode] :: Mode -> Text
pattern Mode_AMAZON_COGNITO_USER_POOLS :: Mode
pattern Mode_API_KEY :: Mode
pattern Mode_AWS_IAM :: Mode
pattern Mode_OPENID_CONNECT :: Mode
newtype OAuthGrantType
OAuthGrantType' :: Text -> OAuthGrantType
[fromOAuthGrantType] :: OAuthGrantType -> Text
pattern OAuthGrantType_CODE :: OAuthGrantType
pattern OAuthGrantType_IMPLICIT :: OAuthGrantType
newtype OAuthScopesElement
OAuthScopesElement' :: Text -> OAuthScopesElement
[fromOAuthScopesElement] :: OAuthScopesElement -> Text
pattern OAuthScopesElement_AWS_COGNITO_SIGNIN_USER_ADMIN :: OAuthScopesElement
pattern OAuthScopesElement_EMAIL :: OAuthScopesElement
pattern OAuthScopesElement_OPENID :: OAuthScopesElement
pattern OAuthScopesElement_PHONE :: OAuthScopesElement
pattern OAuthScopesElement_PROFILE :: OAuthScopesElement
newtype RequiredSignUpAttributesElement
RequiredSignUpAttributesElement' :: Text -> RequiredSignUpAttributesElement
[fromRequiredSignUpAttributesElement] :: RequiredSignUpAttributesElement -> Text
pattern RequiredSignUpAttributesElement_ADDRESS :: RequiredSignUpAttributesElement
pattern RequiredSignUpAttributesElement_BIRTHDATE :: RequiredSignUpAttributesElement
pattern RequiredSignUpAttributesElement_EMAIL :: RequiredSignUpAttributesElement
pattern RequiredSignUpAttributesElement_FAMILY_NAME :: RequiredSignUpAttributesElement
pattern RequiredSignUpAttributesElement_GENDER :: RequiredSignUpAttributesElement
pattern RequiredSignUpAttributesElement_GIVEN_NAME :: RequiredSignUpAttributesElement
pattern RequiredSignUpAttributesElement_LOCALE :: RequiredSignUpAttributesElement
pattern RequiredSignUpAttributesElement_MIDDLE_NAME :: RequiredSignUpAttributesElement
pattern RequiredSignUpAttributesElement_NAME :: RequiredSignUpAttributesElement
pattern RequiredSignUpAttributesElement_NICKNAME :: RequiredSignUpAttributesElement
pattern RequiredSignUpAttributesElement_PHONE_NUMBER :: RequiredSignUpAttributesElement
pattern RequiredSignUpAttributesElement_PICTURE :: RequiredSignUpAttributesElement
pattern RequiredSignUpAttributesElement_PREFERRED_USERNAME :: RequiredSignUpAttributesElement
pattern RequiredSignUpAttributesElement_PROFILE :: RequiredSignUpAttributesElement
pattern RequiredSignUpAttributesElement_UPDATED_AT :: RequiredSignUpAttributesElement
pattern RequiredSignUpAttributesElement_WEBSITE :: RequiredSignUpAttributesElement
pattern RequiredSignUpAttributesElement_ZONE_INFO :: RequiredSignUpAttributesElement
newtype ResolutionStrategy
ResolutionStrategy' :: Text -> ResolutionStrategy
[fromResolutionStrategy] :: ResolutionStrategy -> Text
pattern ResolutionStrategy_AUTOMERGE :: ResolutionStrategy
pattern ResolutionStrategy_LAMBDA :: ResolutionStrategy
pattern ResolutionStrategy_NONE :: ResolutionStrategy
pattern ResolutionStrategy_OPTIMISTIC_CONCURRENCY :: ResolutionStrategy
newtype Service
Service' :: Text -> Service
[fromService] :: Service -> Text
pattern Service_COGNITO :: Service
newtype SignInMethod
SignInMethod' :: Text -> SignInMethod
[fromSignInMethod] :: SignInMethod -> Text
pattern SignInMethod_EMAIL :: SignInMethod
pattern SignInMethod_EMAIL_AND_PHONE_NUMBER :: SignInMethod
pattern SignInMethod_PHONE_NUMBER :: SignInMethod
pattern SignInMethod_USERNAME :: SignInMethod
newtype Status
Status' :: Text -> Status
[fromStatus] :: Status -> Text
pattern Status_LATEST :: Status
pattern Status_STALE :: Status

-- | The authentication settings for accessing provisioned data models in
--   your Amplify project.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings</a> smart constructor.
data BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings
BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings

-- | The OpenID provider name, if OpenID was used as an authentication
--   mechanism to access your data models.
[$sel:openIDProviderName:BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings'] :: BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The clientID for openID, if openID was used as an authentication
--   setting to access your data models.
[$sel:openIDClientId:BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings'] :: BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The openID issuer URL, if openID was used as an authentication setting
--   to access your data models.
[$sel:openIDIssueURL:BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings'] :: BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Cognito user pool ID, if Amazon Cognito was used as an
--   authentication setting to access your data models.
[$sel:cognitoUserPoolId:BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings'] :: BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The expiry time for the OpenID authentication mechanism.
[$sel:openIDAuthTTL:BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings'] :: BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The API key description for API_KEY, if it was used as an
--   authentication mechanism to access your data models.
[$sel:description:BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings'] :: BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The API key expiration time for API_KEY, if it was used as an
--   authentication mechanism to access your data models.
[$sel:expirationTime:BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings'] :: BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings -> Maybe Double

-- | The expiry time for the OpenID authentication mechanism.
[$sel:openIDIatTTL:BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings'] :: BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings -> Maybe Text

--   optional fields omitted.

--   description for API_KEY, if it was used as an authentication mechanism
--   to access your data models.
--

--   expiration time for API_KEY, if it was used as an authentication

--   to access your data models.

--   authentication setting to access your data models.

backendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings_openIDAuthTTL :: Lens' BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings (Maybe Text)

--   authentication mechanism to access your data models.

--   authentication mechanism to access your data models.
backendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings_expirationTime :: Lens' BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings (Maybe Double)

backendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings_openIDIatTTL :: Lens' BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings (Maybe Text)

--   part of your Amplify project.

--   GraphQL schema.

--   models.
[$sel:additionalAuthTypes:BackendAPIResourceConfig'] :: BackendAPIResourceConfig -> Maybe [BackendAPIAuthType]

-- | The conflict resolution strategy for your data stored in the data
--   models.
[$sel:conflictResolution:BackendAPIResourceConfig'] :: BackendAPIResourceConfig -> Maybe BackendAPIConflictResolution

--   data models in your Amplify project.

-- | Describes the forgot password policy for authenticating into the
--   Amplify app.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig
CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig' :: Maybe EmailSettings -> Maybe SmsSettings -> DeliveryMethod -> CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig

-- | The configuration for the email sent when an app user forgets their
--   password.
[$sel:emailSettings:CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig'] :: CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig -> Maybe EmailSettings

-- | The configuration for the SMS message sent when an app user forgets
--   their password.
[$sel:smsSettings:CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig'] :: CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig -> Maybe SmsSettings

-- | Describes which mode to use (either SMS or email) to deliver messages
--   to app users who want to recover their password.
[$sel:deliveryMethod:CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig'] :: CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig -> DeliveryMethod

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.

--   password.
--

--   <a>createBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig_smsSettings</a> - The
--   configuration for the SMS message sent when an app user forgets their
--   password.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryMethod:CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig'</a>,
--   <a>createBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig_deliveryMethod</a> -
--   Describes which mode to use (either SMS or email) to deliver messages
--   to app users who want to recover their password.

-- | Creates the OAuth configuration for your Amplify project.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig</a> smart constructor.
data CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig
CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig' :: Maybe SocialProviderSettings -> Maybe Text -> [Text] -> [Text] -> OAuthGrantType -> [OAuthScopesElement] -> CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig

-- | The settings for using social providers to access your Amplify app.
[$sel:socialProviderSettings:CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig'] :: CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig -> Maybe SocialProviderSettings

-- | The domain prefix for your Amplify app.
[$sel:domainPrefix:CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig'] :: CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | Redirect URLs that OAuth uses when a user signs out of an Amplify app.
[$sel:redirectSignOutURIs:CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig'] :: CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig -> [Text]

-- | The redirected URI for signing in to your Amplify app.
[$sel:redirectSignInURIs:CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig'] :: CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig -> [Text]

-- | The OAuth grant type that you use to allow app users to authenticate
--   from your Amplify app.
[$sel:oAuthGrantType:CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig'] :: CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig -> OAuthGrantType

-- | List of OAuth-related flows used to allow your app users to
--   authenticate from your Amplify app.
[$sel:oAuthScopes:CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig'] :: CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig -> [OAuthScopesElement]

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   for your Amplify app.

--   URLs that OAuth uses when a user signs out of an Amplify app.

--   redirected URI for signing in to your Amplify app.

--   your Amplify app.

--   authenticate from your Amplify app.

--   project.

-- | The OAuth configurations for authenticating users into your Amplify
--   app.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig
UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig' :: Maybe SocialProviderSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [OAuthScopesElement] -> Maybe OAuthGrantType -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig

-- | Describes third-party social federation configurations for allowing
--   your users to sign in with OAuth.
[$sel:socialProviderSettings:UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig'] :: UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig -> Maybe SocialProviderSettings

-- | The Amazon Cognito domain prefix used to create a hosted UI for
--   authentication.

-- | The list of OAuth-related flows that can allow users to authenticate
--   from your Amplify app.

-- | The OAuth grant type to allow app users to authenticate from your
--   Amplify app.
[$sel:oAuthGrantType:UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig'] :: UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig -> Maybe OAuthGrantType

-- | Redirect URLs that OAuth uses when a user signs out of an Amplify app.
[$sel:redirectSignOutURIs:UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig'] :: UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Redirect URLs that OAuth uses when a user signs in to an Amplify app.

-- | Lists the jobs for the backend of an Amplify app.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.ListBackendJobs

-- | The request body for ListBackendJobs.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListBackendJobs</a> smart constructor.
data ListBackendJobs
ListBackendJobs' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> Text -> ListBackendJobs

-- | Filters the list of response objects to include only those with the
--   specified status.
[$sel:status:ListBackendJobs'] :: ListBackendJobs -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID for the job.
[$sel:jobId:ListBackendJobs'] :: ListBackendJobs -> Maybe Text

-- | Filters the list of response objects to include only those with the
--   specified operation name.
[$sel:operation:ListBackendJobs'] :: ListBackendJobs -> Maybe Text

-- | The token for the next set of results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListBackendJobs'] :: ListBackendJobs -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of results that you want in the response.
[$sel:maxResults:ListBackendJobs'] :: ListBackendJobs -> Maybe Natural

-- | The app ID.
[$sel:appId:ListBackendJobs'] :: ListBackendJobs -> Text

-- | The name of the backend environment.
[$sel:backendEnvironmentName:ListBackendJobs'] :: ListBackendJobs -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListBackendJobs</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ListBackendJobs'</a>, <a>listBackendJobs_status</a> -
--   Filters the list of response objects to include only those with the
--   specified status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:ListBackendJobs'</a>, <a>listBackendJobs_jobId</a> - The
--   ID for the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:operation:ListBackendJobs'</a>,
--   <a>listBackendJobs_operation</a> - Filters the list of response
--   objects to include only those with the specified operation name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListBackendJobs'</a>,
--   <a>listBackendJobs_nextToken</a> - The token for the next set of
--   results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListBackendJobs'</a>,
--   <a>listBackendJobs_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of results that
--   you want in the response.
--   
--   <a>$sel:appId:ListBackendJobs'</a>, <a>listBackendJobs_appId</a> - The
--   app ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backendEnvironmentName:ListBackendJobs'</a>,
--   <a>listBackendJobs_backendEnvironmentName</a> - The name of the
--   backend environment.
newListBackendJobs :: Text -> Text -> ListBackendJobs

-- | Filters the list of response objects to include only those with the
--   specified status.
listBackendJobs_status :: Lens' ListBackendJobs (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID for the job.
listBackendJobs_jobId :: Lens' ListBackendJobs (Maybe Text)

-- | Filters the list of response objects to include only those with the
--   specified operation name.
listBackendJobs_operation :: Lens' ListBackendJobs (Maybe Text)

-- | The token for the next set of results.
listBackendJobs_nextToken :: Lens' ListBackendJobs (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of results that you want in the response.
listBackendJobs_maxResults :: Lens' ListBackendJobs (Maybe Natural)

-- | The app ID.
listBackendJobs_appId :: Lens' ListBackendJobs Text

-- | The name of the backend environment.
listBackendJobs_backendEnvironmentName :: Lens' ListBackendJobs Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListBackendJobsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListBackendJobsResponse
ListBackendJobsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [BackendJobRespObj] -> Int -> ListBackendJobsResponse

-- | The token for the next set of results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListBackendJobsResponse'] :: ListBackendJobsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of jobs and their properties.
[$sel:jobs:ListBackendJobsResponse'] :: ListBackendJobsResponse -> Maybe [BackendJobRespObj]

-- | The response's http status code.

--   fields omitted.

--   of results.

--   <a>$sel:jobs:ListBackendJobsResponse'</a>,

--   properties.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListBackendJobsResponse'</a>,

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newImportBackendAuth</a> smart constructor.

-- | Gets the challenge token based on the given appId and sessionId.
module Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.GetToken

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetToken</a> smart constructor.
data GetToken
GetToken' :: Text -> Text -> GetToken

-- | The session ID.
[$sel:sessionId:GetToken'] :: GetToken -> Text

-- | The app ID.
[$sel:appId:GetToken'] :: GetToken -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetToken</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   session ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:appId:GetToken'</a>, <a>getToken_appId</a> - The app ID.
newGetToken :: Text -> Text -> GetToken

-- | The session ID.
getToken_sessionId :: Lens' GetToken Text

-- | The app ID.
getToken_appId :: Lens' GetToken Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetTokenResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetTokenResponse
GetTokenResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Int -> GetTokenResponse

-- | The expiry time for the one-time generated token code.
[$sel:ttl:GetTokenResponse'] :: GetTokenResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The app ID.
[$sel:appId:GetTokenResponse'] :: GetTokenResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A unique ID provided when creating a new challenge token.
[$sel:sessionId:GetTokenResponse'] :: GetTokenResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The one-time challenge code for authenticating into the Amplify Admin
--   UI.
[$sel:challengeCode:GetTokenResponse'] :: GetTokenResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetTokenResponse'] :: GetTokenResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>GetTokenResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ttl:GetTokenResponse'</a>, <a>getTokenResponse_ttl</a> - The
--   expiry time for the one-time generated token code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:appId:GetToken'</a>, <a>getTokenResponse_appId</a> - The app
--   ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sessionId:GetToken'</a>, <a>getTokenResponse_sessionId</a> - A
--   unique ID provided when creating a new challenge token.
--   
--   <a>$sel:challengeCode:GetTokenResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getTokenResponse_challengeCode</a> - The one-time challenge code
--   for authenticating into the Amplify Admin UI.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetTokenResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getTokenResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status code.
newGetTokenResponse :: Int -> GetTokenResponse

-- | The expiry time for the one-time generated token code.
getTokenResponse_ttl :: Lens' GetTokenResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The app ID.
getTokenResponse_appId :: Lens' GetTokenResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A unique ID provided when creating a new challenge token.
getTokenResponse_sessionId :: Lens' GetTokenResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The one-time challenge code for authenticating into the Amplify Admin
--   UI.
getTokenResponse_challengeCode :: Lens' GetTokenResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
getTokenResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetTokenResponse Int

-- | Gets a backend auth details.
module Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.GetBackendAuth

-- | The request body for GetBackendAuth.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetBackendAuth</a> smart constructor.
data GetBackendAuth
GetBackendAuth' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> GetBackendAuth

-- | The app ID.
[$sel:appId:GetBackendAuth'] :: GetBackendAuth -> Text

-- | The name of the backend environment.
[$sel:backendEnvironmentName:GetBackendAuth'] :: GetBackendAuth -> Text

-- | The name of this resource.

-- | Generates a model schema for an existing backend API resource.
module Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.GenerateBackendAPIModels

-- | The request body for GenerateBackendAPIModels.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGenerateBackendAPIModels</a> smart constructor.
data GenerateBackendAPIModels
GenerateBackendAPIModels' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> GenerateBackendAPIModels

-- | The app ID.
[$sel:appId:GenerateBackendAPIModels'] :: GenerateBackendAPIModels -> Text

-- | The name of the backend environment.
[$sel:backendEnvironmentName:GenerateBackendAPIModels'] :: GenerateBackendAPIModels -> Text

-- | The name of this resource.
[$sel:resourceName:GenerateBackendAPIModels'] :: GenerateBackendAPIModels -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GenerateBackendAPIModels</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:appId:GenerateBackendAPIModels'</a>,
--   <a>generateBackendAPIModels_appId</a> - The app ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backendEnvironmentName:GenerateBackendAPIModels'</a>,
--   <a>generateBackendAPIModels_backendEnvironmentName</a> - The name of
--   the backend environment.
--

--   resource.

--   code.

-- | The ID for the job.

--   Amplify Admin UI.

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.CreateBackendAPI.CreateBackendAPI


-- | This operation creates a backend for an Amplify app. Backends are
--   automatically created at the time of app creation.
module Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.CreateBackend

-- | The request body for CreateBackend.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateBackend</a> smart constructor.
data CreateBackend
CreateBackend' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ResourceConfig -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CreateBackend

-- | The name of the resource.

-- | The resource configuration for the create backend request.

-- | The name of the backend environment.
[$sel:backendEnvironmentName:CreateBackend'] :: CreateBackend -> Text

-- | This operation clones an existing backend.
module Network.AWS.AmplifyBackend.CloneBackend

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCloneBackend</a> smart constructor.

-- | Updates the AWS resources required to access the Amplify Admin UI.

createTokenResponse_ttl :: Lens' CreateTokenResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The app ID.
createTokenResponse_appId :: Lens' CreateTokenResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A unique ID provided when creating a new challenge token.
createTokenResponse_sessionId :: Lens' CreateTokenResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | One-time challenge code for authenticating into the Amplify Admin UI.
createTokenResponse_challengeCode :: Lens' CreateTokenResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
createTokenResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateTokenResponse Int

-- | Describes third-party social federation configurations for allowing
--   your users to sign in with OAuth.
updateBackendAuthOAuthConfig_socialProviderSettings :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig (Maybe SocialProviderSettings)

-- | The Amazon Cognito domain prefix used to create a hosted UI for
--   authentication.
updateBackendAuthOAuthConfig_domainPrefix :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of OAuth-related flows that can allow users to authenticate
--   from your Amplify app.
updateBackendAuthOAuthConfig_oAuthScopes :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig (Maybe [OAuthScopesElement])

-- | The OAuth grant type to allow app users to authenticate from your
--   Amplify app.
updateBackendAuthOAuthConfig_oAuthGrantType :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig (Maybe OAuthGrantType)

-- | Redirect URLs that OAuth uses when a user signs out of an Amplify app.
updateBackendAuthOAuthConfig_redirectSignOutURIs :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig (Maybe [Text])

-- | Redirect URLs that OAuth uses when a user signs in to an Amplify app.
updateBackendAuthOAuthConfig_redirectSignInURIs :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig (Maybe [Text])

-- | Describes additional constraints on password requirements to sign in
--   to the auth resource, configured as a part of your Amplify project.
updateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig_additionalConstraints :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig (Maybe [AdditionalConstraintsElement])

-- | Describes the minimum length of the password required to sign in to
--   the auth resource, configured as a part of your Amplify project.
updateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig_minimumLength :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig (Maybe Double)

-- | Describes the authorization configuration for the Amazon Cognito
--   identity pool, provisioned as a part of your auth resource in the
--   Amplify project.
updateBackendAuthResourceConfig_identityPoolConfigs :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig (Maybe UpdateBackendAuthIdentityPoolConfig)

-- | Defines the service name to use when configuring an authentication
--   resource in your Amplify project.
updateBackendAuthResourceConfig_authResources :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig AuthResources

-- | Describes the authentication configuration for the Amazon Cognito user
--   pool, provisioned as a part of your auth resource in the Amplify
--   project.
updateBackendAuthResourceConfig_userPoolConfigs :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig UpdateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig

-- | Defines the service name to use when configuring an authentication
--   resource in your Amplify project.
updateBackendAuthResourceConfig_service :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthResourceConfig Service

-- | Describes the password policy for your Amazon Cognito user pool,
--   configured as a part of your Amplify project.
updateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig_passwordPolicy :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig (Maybe UpdateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig)

-- | Describes whether to apply multi-factor authentication policies for
--   your Amazon Cognito user pool configured as a part of your Amplify
--   project.
updateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig_mfa :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig (Maybe UpdateBackendAuthMFAConfig)

-- | Describes the forgot password policy for your Amazon Cognito user
--   pool, configured as a part of your Amplify project.
updateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig_forgotPassword :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig (Maybe UpdateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig)

-- | Describes the OAuth policy and rules for your Amazon Cognito user
--   pool, configured as a part of your Amplify project.
updateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig_oAuth :: Lens' UpdateBackendAuthUserPoolConfig (Maybe UpdateBackendAuthOAuthConfig)

--   AWS Amplify Admin API

-- | API version <tt>2020-08-11</tt> of the Amazon AmplifyBackend SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | An error returned if there's a temporary issue with the service.
_GatewayTimeoutException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An error returned when a specific resource type is not found.
_NotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An error that is returned when a limit of a specific type has been
--   exceeded.
_TooManyRequestsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An error returned if a request is not formed properly.
_BadRequestException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateBackendResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CreateBackendResponse
CreateBackendResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Int -> CreateBackendResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateBackendResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:CreateBackendResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createBackendResponse_status</a> - The current status of the
--   request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:CreateBackendResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createBackendResponse_jobId</a> - The ID for the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:operation:CreateBackendResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createBackendResponse_operation</a> - The name of the operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:error:CreateBackendResponse'</a>,

--   is returned.

-- | The authentication settings for accessing provisioned data models in
--   your Amplify project.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings</a> smart constructor.
data BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings
BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:openIDProviderName:BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings'</a>,
--   <a>backendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings_openIDProviderName</a> - The OpenID
--   provider name, if OpenID was used as an authentication mechanism to
--   access your data models.
--   
--   <a>$sel:openIDClientId:BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings'</a>,
--   <a>backendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings_openIDClientId</a> - The clientID for
--   openID, if openID was used as an authentication setting to access your
--   data models.
--   
--   <a>$sel:openIDIssueURL:BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings'</a>,
--   <a>backendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings_openIDIssueURL</a> - The openID
--   issuer URL, if openID was used as an authentication setting to access
--   your data models.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cognitoUserPoolId:BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings'</a>,
--   <a>backendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings_cognitoUserPoolId</a> - The Amazon
--   Cognito user pool ID, if Amazon Cognito was used as an authentication
--   setting to access your data models.
--   
--   <a>$sel:openIDAuthTTL:BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings'</a>,
--   <a>backendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings_openIDAuthTTL</a> - The expiry time
--   for the OpenID authentication mechanism.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings'</a>,
--   <a>backendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings_description</a> - The API key
--   description for API_KEY, if it was used as an authentication mechanism
--   to access your data models.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expirationTime:BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings'</a>,
--   <a>backendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings_expirationTime</a> - The API key
--   expiration time for API_KEY, if it was used as an authentication
--   mechanism to access your data models.
--   
--   <a>$sel:openIDIatTTL:BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings'</a>,
--   <a>backendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings_openIDIatTTL</a> - The expiry time
--   for the OpenID authentication mechanism.
newBackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings :: BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings

-- | Describes the auth types for your configured data models.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackendAPIAuthType</a> smart constructor.
data BackendAPIAuthType

--   password.
--   
--   <a>$sel:smsSettings:UpdateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig'</a>,
--   <a>updateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig_smsSettings</a> - The
--   configuration for the SMS message sent when an Amplify app user
--   forgets their password.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryMethod:UpdateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig'</a>,
--   <a>updateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig_deliveryMethod</a> -
--   Describes which mode to use (either SMS or email) to deliver messages
--   to app users that want to recover their password.
newUpdateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig :: UpdateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig
